note that it's probably cleaner to merge the gtest PR first

update.description: This removes boost by replacing boost::any and boost::variant with the std equivalents.
update.title: removal of boost

content.raw:
I don’t know if it’s necessary to use it, but CMake provides a variable for setting the C\+\+ Standard:

[https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.1/variable/CMAKE\_CXX\_STANDARD.html](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.1/variable/CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD.html)

Which ends up looking like:

    set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 11) 
    set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)

‌
content.html:
I don’t know if it’s necessary to use it, but CMake provides a variable for setting the C++ Standard:

https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.1/variable/CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD.html

Which ends up looking like:

set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 11) 
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD_REQUIRED ON)

‌

content.raw: Yes, the cpplint.py script in sdformat is not up to date with c\+\+11 styling. An updated [cpplint.p](http://cpplint.pt)y script has even more errors. I’ll try to suppress the current warnings.
content.html: Yes, the cpplint.py script in sdformat is not up to date with c++11 styling. An updated cpplint.py script has even more errors. I’ll try to suppress the current warnings.
